name: Venusaur & Snivy-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, when you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to it, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with their Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. If this Pokemon has at least 2 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Oddish
flavorText: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokemon.

name: Gloom
flavorText: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Vileplume-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Tangela
flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.

name: Tangrowth
flavorText: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokemon's Retreat Cost.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

name: Sunkern
flavorText: It may plummet from the sky. If attacked by a Spearow, it will violently shake its leaves.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Sunflora
flavorText: As the hot season approaches, the petals on this Pokemon's face become more vivid and lively.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, ignore all Energy in the attack costs of Grass Pokemon and Fire Pokemon. (This includes Pokemon that come into play on that turn.)

name: Heracross
flavorText: It's proud of its thick horn. In Alola, its biggest rival is Vikavolt, which it's always fighting with.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any TAG TEAM Pokemon in play, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Lileep
flavorText: In ancient times, it lived in warm seas. It disguised itself as seaweed to ambush its prey and devoured them whole when they got close.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Cradily
flavorText: Normally, it lived on shallow sea shoals. When the tide went out, this Pokemon came up on land to search for prey.
Ability1Text: Your opponent's Pokemon that are affected by Special Conditions can't retreat.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Tropius
flavorText: The bunches of fruit growing around the necks of Tropius in Alola are especially sweet compared to those in other regions.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokemon. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Kricketot
flavorText: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Kricketune
flavorText: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
Attack1Text: If you have exactly 1 card in your hand, this attack does 100 more damage. If you have exactly 3 cards in your hand, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused. If you have exactly 6 cards in your hand, this attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Deerling
flavorText: Their coloring changes according to the season and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.

name: Sawsbuck
flavorText: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.
Attack1Text: You may switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Rowlet
flavorText: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Rowlet
flavorText: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Dartrix
flavorText: This narcissistic Pokemon is a clean freak. If you don't groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.
Attack2Text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon.

name: Decidueye
flavorText: It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at opponents. When it simply can't afford to miss, it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.
Attack1Text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Buzzwole
flavorText: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
Ability1Text: This Pokemon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokemon for each Prize card you have taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Charizard & Braixen-GX
Attack1Text: You may search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokemon in any way you like. If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned and Confused. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Ponyta
flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Rapidash
flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokemon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Flareon
flavorText: If it inhales deeply, that's a sign it's about to attack. Prepare to be hit by flames of over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit!
Ability1Text: The attacks of your Pokemon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Power Cheer Ability at a time.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Slugma
flavorText: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Magcargo
flavorText: Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames that circulate throughout its body.
Attack1Text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Entei
flavorText: A Pokemon that races across the land. It is said that one is born every time a new volcano appears.
Attack1Text: If any of your Pokemon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Torkoal
flavorText: You can tell how it's feeling by the smoke spouting from its shell. Tremendous velocity is a sign of good health.
Attack1Text: Put 4 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Victini
flavorText: This Pokemon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Tepig
flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

name: Pignite
flavorText: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.

name: Emboar
flavorText: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokemon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Larvesta
flavorText: When battling opponents, it sprays fire from its five horns. The max temperature of the flames can reach nearly 5,500 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Volcarona-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Put 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokemon into your hand.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Litleo
flavorText: When they're young, they live with a pride. Once they're able to hunt prey on their own, they're kicked out and have to make their own way.

name: Pyroar
flavorText: The males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.
Attack1Text: Discard all Pokemon Tool cards and Special Energy from each of your opponent's Pokemon.

name: Blastoise & Piplup-GX
Attack1Text: You may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokemon in any way you like. If you do, heal 50 damage from those Pokemon for each card you attached to them in this way.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokemon has at least 3 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Alolan Vulpix
flavorText: If you carelessly approach it because it's cute, the boss of the pack, Ninetales, will appear and freeze you.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

name: Psyduck
flavorText: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it normally passes the time spacing out and doing as little as possible.
Attack2Text: Both Active Pokemon are now Confused.

name: Golduck
flavorText: Even fast-swimming fish Pokemon can be disabled by Golduck. It brings them to a standstill and seizes them.
Attack2Text: Put an Energy attached to this Pokemon into your hand.

name: Vaporeon
flavorText: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When it's about to be attacked by an invading enemy, it dives into the water to hide.
Ability1Text: Your Pokemon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee get +60 HP. You can't apply more than 1 Vitality Cheer Ability at a time.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokemon.

name: Sneasel
flavorText: They will cooperate to steal eggs from the nests of bird Pokemon, but fights break out to determine which one gets to eat the eggs.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Weavile
flavorText: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Wailmer
flavorText: It swims along with its mouth open and swallows down seawater along with its food. It sprays excess water out of its nostrils.

name: Wailord
flavorText: They eat so many fish Pokemon that when Wailord become too numerous, fishermen have to chase them off.

name: Snorunt
flavorText: It feeds mainly on ice and snow. It's only able to survive in a limited number of places in the warm Alola region.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

name: Glalie
flavorText: It freezes its prey and chews them whole. However, it prefers to eat Pokemon like Vanillite that are already frozen.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed, and discard an Energy from that Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Frosty Typhoon during your next turn.

name: Spheal
flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy, they clap fins.

name: Spheal
flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy, they clap fins.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Sealeo
flavorText: It has a very sensitive nose. It touches new things with its nose to examine them.

name: Walrein
flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.
Attack1Text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from their hand during their next turn. If 1 of your Pokemon used Cold Snap during your last turn, this attack can't be used.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Kyogre
flavorText: A mythical Pokemon said to have swelled the seas with rain and tidal waves. It battled with Groudon.
Attack1Text: Attach 2 Water Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Piplup
flavorText: It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is a Basic Pokemon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Prinplup
flavorText: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokemon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Empoleon
flavorText: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.
Attack1Text: Choose an attack from 1 of this Pokemon's previous Evolutions and use it as this attack.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Phione
flavorText: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is on your Bench, you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon. If you do, discard all cards attached to this Pokemon and put it on the bottom of your deck.

name: Tympole
flavorText: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Ducklett
flavorText: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Swanna
flavorText: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.
Attack1Text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Black Kyurem
flavorText: This legendary ice Pokemon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
Attack1Text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If you have any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Wishiwashi
flavorText: Wishiwashi assemble in this formation to face off against strong foes. It boasts a strength that earned it the name "demon of the sea."
Ability1Text: At the end of your opponent's turn, if this Pokemon has any damage counters on it, flip a coin. If tails, shuffle this Pokemon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

name: Wishiwashi-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Wishiwashi and Wishiwashi-GX in play.
Attack2Text: Look at the top 12 cards of your deck and put any number of Basic Pokemon you find there onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Dewpider
flavorText: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other's way.

name: Araquanid
flavorText: It usually passes its time in the water. When its belly is full, it stores its subdued prey in the water bubble on its head.
Attack2Text: During your next turn, the Defending Pokemon takes 60 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Pikachu
flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon does 10 damage to itself.

name: Raichu
flavorText: As electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes more aggressive. One theory is that the electricity buildup is actually causing stress.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Lightning Energy attached to all of your Pokemon.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

name: Magneton
flavorText: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas inhabited by Magneton, which send out mysterious electrical signals.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for up to 3 Supporter cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, this Pokemon is Knocked Out.

name: Jolteon
flavorText: Its lungs contain an organ that creates electricity. The crackling sound of electricity can be heard when it exhales.
Ability1Text: The attacks of your Pokemon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee cost Colorless less. You can't apply more than 1 Speed Cheer Ability at a time.

name: Chinchou
flavorText: Its two antennae glow softly to lure in prey, making it a useful Pokemon for night fishing.
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

name: Lanturn
flavorText: When the bacteria living inside its antennae absorb Lanturn's bodily fluids, a strong luminescent effect is produced.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top card of your opponent's deck.
Attack1Text: You may have your opponent shuffle their deck.

name: Togedemaru
flavorText: When it's surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Togedemaru
flavorText: When it's surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Solgaleo & Lunala-GX
Attack1Text: This Pokemon can't use Cosmic Burn during your next turn.
Attack2Text: If you played Lillie's Full Force from your hand during this turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to each of your Pokemon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Koffing
flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you discard this Pokemon with the effect of Roxie, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Place damage counters after the effect of Roxie.)
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Weezing
flavorText: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you discard this Pokemon with the effect of Roxie, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Place damage counters after the effect of Roxie.)
Attack1Text: Discard this Pokemon and all cards attached to it.

name: Natu
flavorText: Although it still can't fly, its jumping power is outstanding. It jumps way up into trees and plucks the buds from the branches.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 4 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

name: Xatu
flavorText: It's said that while this Pokemon has the power to predict the future, it's not powerful enough to change the future it sees.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokemon until its remaining HP is 10.

name: Ralts
flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokemon, its body warms up slightly.
Attack1Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Kirlia
flavorText: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Gallade
flavorText: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is in play, it is Psychic and Fighting type.
Attack1Text: Move an Energy from this Pokemon to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Duskull
flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 3 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokemon and put it onto this Pokemon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.

name: Dusclops
flavorText: Anyone who dares peer into its body to see its spectral ball of fire will have their spirit stolen away.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokemon's attacks. That Pokemon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Dusknoir
flavorText: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokemon in any way you like.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon's Psych Up attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Rotom
flavorText: Research continues on this Pokemon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.
Attack1Text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Benched Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Woobat
flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Swoobat
flavorText: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Your opponent chooses 1 of their own Pokemon. This attack does 90 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Golett
flavorText: Its movements are powered by a mysterious energy. It has continued to move since ancient times, so its power may soon run out.
Attack1Text: You may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

name: Golurk
flavorText: Some say that ancient people invented Golurk to serve as a laborer. It follows its master's orders faithfully.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Attack2Text: If you have any Supporter cards in your discard pile, this attack does nothing.

name: Skrelp
flavorText: It vanishes into seaweed and remains perfectly still to avoid attacks from large Pokemon. Rotten seaweed is its main food source.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Dragalge
flavorText: This vicious Pokemon sprays a poisonous liquid on opponents that come near. For whatever reason, it gets along really well with Dhelmise.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Poisoned, put 10 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.

name: Phantump
flavorText: By imitating the voice of a child, it causes people to get hopelessly lost deep in the forest. It's trying to make friends with them.

name: Trevenant
flavorText: It's feared as a ghost of the forest. Lumberjacks bring along Fire types, which Trevenant hates, when they enter the forest.
Attack1Text: You may have your opponent switch their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Put 4 damage counters on 1 of your Pokemon.

name: Oricorio-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokemon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dance of Tribute Ability each turn.
Attack2Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Mimikyu
flavorText: Although it's a quiet, lonely Pokemon, if you try to look at what's under its rag, it will become agitated and resist violently.
Attack1Text: Discard a Supporter card from your hand. If you do, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.
Attack2Text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokemon and put 2 damage counters on each of them.

name: Mimikyu
flavorText: Although it's a quiet, lonely Pokemon, if you try to look at what's under its rag, it will become agitated and resist violently.
Ability1Text: Pokemon-GX that have any damage counters on them (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Dhelmise
flavorText: It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey like Wailord.
Attack1Text: Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Cosmog
flavorText: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokemon and put it onto this Pokemon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Cosmog
flavorText: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Cosmoem
flavorText: The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the "cocoon of the stars" and built an altar to worship it.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 40 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Lunala
flavorText: Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name "the beast that calls the moon."
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Solgaleo in play, you may search your deck for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to your Solgaleo or Lunala in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Marshadow
flavorText: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it's imitating.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokemon's non-GX attacks and use it as this attack.

name: Blacephalon
flavorText: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
Attack1Text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokemon in any way you like. If your opponent has exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, put 12 damage counters on them instead.

name: Onix
flavorText: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
Attack1Text: Put an Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Nosepass
flavorText: It moves less than an inch a year, but when it's in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.
Attack1Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with their Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

name: Trapinch
flavorText: Its jaws are strong enough to crush rocks but so heavy that it can't get up if it flips over. Sandile seize those moments as their chance.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Trapinch
flavorText: Its jaws are strong enough to crush rocks but so heavy that it can't get up if it flips over. Sandile seize those moments as their chance.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Vibrava
flavorText: It vibrates its wings to generate ultrasonic waves, causing its prey to faint. Then it buries the prey alive in the sand to preserve it.
Ability1Text: Whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokemon.

name: Flygon-GX
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, all of your Pokemon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Anorith
flavorText: When restored Anorith are released into the ocean, they don't thrive, because the water composition has changed since their era.

name: Armaldo
flavorText: It lived on land and went out into the sea to hunt for prey. Its sharp claws were its greatest weapon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Unidentified Fossil card in your discard pile.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Groudon
flavorText: Said to have expanded the lands by evaporating water with raging heat. It battled titanically with Kyogre.
Attack1Text: Attach up to 2 Fighting Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Trembling Ground during your next turn.

name: Drilbur
flavorText: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
Attack1Text: Shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.

name: Excadrill
flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
Attack1Text: If there are 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack does 150 more damage.
Attack2Text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

name: Palpitoad
flavorText: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Seismitoad
flavorText: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card, shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Benched Pokemon that has any damage counters on it.

name: Throh
flavorText: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
Attack1Text: If your Benched Pokemon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Pancham
flavorText: It follows Pangoro around like a henchman. When Pancham makes a big mistake, its leaf gets taken away.

name: Pangoro
flavorText: This rowdy Pokemon boasts great physical strength. Many Trainers are also smitten by its lively character.

name: Crabrawler
flavorText: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.

name: Crabominable
flavorText: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!
Ability1Text: This Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: If this Pokemon has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Rockruff
flavorText: As they develop, their disposition grows more violent and aggressive. Many Trainers find them too much to handle and abandon them.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon.

name: Lycanroc
flavorText: It has no problem ignoring orders it doesn't like. It doesn't seem to mind getting hurt at allas long as it can finish off its opponent.
Ability1Text: If your opponent has any Pokemon-GX or Pokemon-EX in play, this Pokemon's attacks cost ColorlessColorlessColorless less.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Passimian
flavorText: They use their saliva to stick leaves to their shoulders. You can tell what troop they belong to from the position of the leaves.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.

name: Sandygast
flavorText: It likes the shovel on its head, so Sandygast will get serious and fight any children who come to take it back.
Attack1Text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

name: Palossand
flavorText: Each of its grains of sand has its own will. Palossand eats small Pokemon and siphons away their vital essence while they're still alive.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Alolan Meowth
flavorText: It's impulsive, selfish, and fickle. It's very popular with some Trainers who like giving it the attention it needs.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Alolan Persian-GX
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon by your opponent's TAG TEAM Pokemon and Ultra Beasts, and by your opponent's Pokemon that have any Special Energy attached to them.
Attack2Text: This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Alolan Grimer
flavorText: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Alolan Muk
flavorText: There are over a hundred kinds of poison inside its body. Chemical reactions between different poisons are the source of its vitality.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

name: Carvanha
flavorText: They're such cowards that they won't hunt alone. When five or so of them get together, they suddenly turn ferocious!
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Absol
flavorText: The only thing unlucky about Absol is its appearance. It protects fields and warns people of disaster, so one ought to be grateful for it.
Attack1Text: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card, this attack does nothing.

name: Pawniard
flavorText: After shredding its prey, it sharpens its blades on a stone by the river. Each Pawniard has its own favorite sharpening stone.
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard an Item card you find there.

name: Bisharp
flavorText: No matter how strong the Bisharp, it's said that if the blade on its head is chipped, it will retire from its position as the boss.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

name: Guzzlord
flavorText: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

name: Alolan Sandshrew
flavorText: After fleeing a volcanic eruption, it ended up moving to an area of snowy mountains. Its ice shell is as hard as steel.
Attack1Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Alolan Sandslash
flavorText: It runs across snow-covered plains at high speeds. It developed thick, sharp claws to plow through the snow.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon has a Pokemon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Steelix
flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.
Attack1Text: Discard any number of Pokemon with a Retreat Cost of exactly 4 from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

name: Mawile
flavorText: A cunning and terrifying Pokemon, its cuteness makes opponents let down their guardand then it swallows them whole with its huge jaws.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 TAG TEAM cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Probopass
flavorText: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don't come back.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

name: Solgaleo
flavorText: Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.
Ability1Text: If you have Lunala in play, your Solgaleo and Lunala take 50 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Armor of the Sunne Ability at a time.
Attack1Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Togepi & Cleffa & Igglybuff-GX
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: Take another turn after this one. (Skip the between-turns step.) If this Pokemon has at least 14 extra Fairy Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles all of their Benched Pokemon and all cards attached to them into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Togepi & Cleffa & Igglybuff-GX
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: Take another turn after this one. (Skip the between-turns step.) If this Pokemon has at least 14 extra Fairy Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles all of their Benched Pokemon and all cards attached to them into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Clefairy
flavorText: They're popular, but they're rare. Trainers who show them off recklessly may be targeted by thieves.
Attack1Text: Put this Pokemon and all cards attached to it into your hand. If you do, you may play Lillie's Poke Doll from your hand as your new Active Pokemon.

name: Alolan Ninetales
flavorText: The reason it guides people all the way down to the mountain's base is that it wants them to hurry up and leave.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage for each Pokemon Tool card in your discard pile.

name: Azurill
flavorText: A Pokemon that lives by water. It moves quickly on land by bouncing on its big tail.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokemon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

name: Cottonee
flavorText: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can't move as well.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokemon, except p (Prism Star) Pokemon, in the Lost Zone.

name: Whimsicott
flavorText: This nuisance sneaks into people's homes, where it hides important things and scatters cotton all over the place.
Attack1Text: Put a card from your hand in the Lost Zone. If you do, draw 3 cards.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokemon, except p (Prism Star) Pokemon, in the Lost Zone.

name: Flabebe
flavorText: It's not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fairy Pokemon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Flabebe
flavorText: It's not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Floette
flavorText: It raises flowers and uses them as weapons. The more gorgeous the blossom, the more power it contains.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may choose 2 random cards from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.

name: Florges
flavorText: It controls the flowers it grows. The petal blizzards that Florges triggers are overwhelming in their beauty and power.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may choose 2 random cards from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads. This Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Swirlix
flavorText: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Slurpuff
flavorText: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon isn't Confused, this attack does nothing.

name: Sylveon
flavorText: Once a fight breaks out, it will unflinchingly charge at dragon Pokemon that are many times larger than itself.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokemon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: If you played a TAG TEAM Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: For the rest of this game, your Pokemon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), when your opponent's Active Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Reshiram & Zekrom-GX
Attack1Text: Discard up to 3 in any combination of basic Fire and basic Lightning Energy cards from your Benched Pokemon. This attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.
Attack2Text: This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. If you played N's Resolve from your hand during this turn, this attack also does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's other Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokemon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy and 1 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 2 Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Drampa
flavorText: If a child it has made friends with is bullied, Drampa will find the bully's house and burn it to the ground.
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon has 2 or more different types of basic Energy attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Jangmo-o
flavorText: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokemon.

name: Jangmo-o
flavorText: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.

name: Hakamo-o
flavorText: It makes noise by clanging its scales together. When the rhythm has reached its peak, Hakamo-o attacks.
Ability1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is a Pokemon-GX or Pokemon-EX, this Pokemon can evolve during the turn you play it.

name: Kommo-o
flavorText: When it howls after finishing off its prey, the metallic sounds of its celebrating comrades can be heard from all around.
Attack1Text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: You may discard a Pokemon Tool card from this Pokemon. If you do, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Ultra Necrozma
flavorText: This is its form when it has absorbed overwhelming light energy. It fires laser beams from all over its body.
Ability1Text: This Pokemon can't attack unless your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Mega Lopunny & Jigglypuff-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 60 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokemon-GX and Pokemon-EX in play.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep. If this Pokemon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 200 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Eevee
evolvesTo: Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon, Sylveon, Espeon, Umbreon, Leafeon, Glaceon
flavorText: The question of why only Eevee has such unstable genes has still not been solved.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Eevee
evolvesTo: Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon, Sylveon, Espeon, Umbreon, Leafeon, Glaceon
flavorText: The question of why only Eevee has such unstable genes has still not been solved.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for any number of Eevee and Eevee-GX and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Igglybuff
flavorText: It's always practicing its singing because it wants to improve. Even when it's asleep, it keeps singing in its dreams!
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

name: Aipom
flavorText: As it did more and more with its tail, its hands became clumsy. It makes its nest high in the treetops.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put the top card of your opponent's deck on the bottom of their deck without looking at it.

name: Ambipom
flavorText: In their search for comfortable trees, they get into territorial disputes with groups of Passimian. They win about half the time.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Teddiursa
flavorText: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they are soaked with honey.

name: Ursaring
flavorText: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailingly finds all food buried deep underground.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Zangoose
flavorText: It has feuded with Seviper for many generations. Its sharp claws are its biggest weapons.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Lillipup
flavorText: This Pokemon has excellent judgment. If it decides it can't defeat an opponent, it immediately turns tail and vamooses.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Herdier
flavorText: The longer its black fur grows, the harder and more impervious it gets. Claws and fangs can't easily penetrate it.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon's attacks do 60 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Stoutland
flavorText: It pays no mind to the cold, thanks to its long warm coat. Stoutland in Alola look a little uncomfortable.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon. If this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Rufflet
flavorText: With its powerful legs and sturdy claws, it can crack even the hard shells of Shellder and pluck out their insides.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Braviary
flavorText: The more scars it has on its front, the more heroic it's considered to be. Those with many scars on their back are mocked by the flock.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Helioptile
flavorText: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Heliolisk
flavorText: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Lightning Pokemon in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Stufful
flavorText: It boasts power enough to split large trees in half. The organ on its rear releases an odor that it uses to communicate with others of its kind.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

name: Bewear
flavorText: It waves its hands wildly in intimidation and warning. Life is over for anyone who doesn't run away as fast as possible.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is on your Bench, your Active Pokemon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless less.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Type: Null
flavorText: A Pokemon weapon developed for a specific mission, it went berserk during an experiment, so it was cryogenically frozen.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Silvally-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.
Attack1Text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is an Ultra Beast, it is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Dragonium Z: Dragon Claw
Attack1Text: Discard all basic Energy from this Pokemon. This attack does 80 damage for each card you discarded in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Venusaur & Snivy-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, when you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to it, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with their Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. If this Pokemon has at least 2 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Vileplume-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Charizard & Braixen-GX
Attack1Text: You may search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokemon in any way you like. If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned and Confused. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Volcarona-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Put 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokemon into your hand.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Blastoise & Piplup-GX
Attack1Text: You may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokemon in any way you like. If you do, heal 50 damage from those Pokemon for each card you attached to them in this way.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokemon has at least 3 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Blastoise & Piplup-GX
Attack1Text: You may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokemon in any way you like. If you do, heal 50 damage from those Pokemon for each card you attached to them in this way.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokemon has at least 3 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Solgaleo & Lunala-GX
Attack1Text: This Pokemon can't use Cosmic Burn during your next turn.
Attack2Text: If you played Lillie's Full Force from your hand during this turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to each of your Pokemon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Oricorio-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokemon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dance of Tribute Ability each turn.
Attack2Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Flygon-GX
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, all of your Pokemon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Alolan Persian-GX
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon by your opponent's TAG TEAM Pokemon and Ultra Beasts, and by your opponent's Pokemon that have any Special Energy attached to them.
Attack2Text: This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: For the rest of this game, your Pokemon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), when your opponent's Active Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: For the rest of this game, your Pokemon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), when your opponent's Active Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Reshiram & Zekrom-GX
Attack1Text: Discard up to 3 in any combination of basic Fire and basic Lightning Energy cards from your Benched Pokemon. This attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.
Attack2Text: This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. If you played N's Resolve from your hand during this turn, this attack also does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's other Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokemon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy and 1 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 2 Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokemon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy and 1 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 2 Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Mega Lopunny & Jigglypuff-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 60 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokemon-GX and Pokemon-EX in play.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep. If this Pokemon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 200 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Mega Lopunny & Jigglypuff-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 60 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokemon-GX and Pokemon-EX in play.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep. If this Pokemon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 200 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Silvally-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.
Attack1Text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is an Ultra Beast, it is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Torkoal
flavorText: You can tell how it's feeling by the smoke spouting from its shell. Tremendous velocity is a sign of good health.
Attack1Text: Put 4 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Weavile
flavorText: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Piplup
flavorText: It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is a Basic Pokemon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Wishiwashi
flavorText: Wishiwashi assemble in this formation to face off against strong foes. It boasts a strength that earned it the name "demon of the sea."
Ability1Text: At the end of your opponent's turn, if this Pokemon has any damage counters on it, flip a coin. If tails, shuffle this Pokemon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon does 10 damage to itself.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

name: Koffing
flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you discard this Pokemon with the effect of Roxie, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Place damage counters after the effect of Roxie.)
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Gallade
flavorText: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is in play, it is Psychic and Fighting type.
Attack1Text: Move an Energy from this Pokemon to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Mimikyu
flavorText: Although it's a quiet, lonely Pokemon, if you try to look at what's under its rag, it will become agitated and resist violently.
Attack1Text: Discard a Supporter card from your hand. If you do, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.
Attack2Text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokemon and put 2 damage counters on each of them.

name: Excadrill
flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
Attack1Text: If there are 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack does 150 more damage.
Attack2Text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

name: Steelix
flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.
Attack1Text: Discard any number of Pokemon with a Retreat Cost of exactly 4 from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

name: Stoutland
flavorText: It pays no mind to the cold, thanks to its long warm coat. Stoutland in Alola look a little uncomfortable.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon. If this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Venusaur & Snivy-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, when you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to it, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with their Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. If this Pokemon has at least 2 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Vileplume-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Charizard & Braixen-GX
Attack1Text: You may search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokemon in any way you like. If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned and Confused. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Volcarona-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Put 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokemon into your hand.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Blastoise & Piplup-GX
Attack1Text: You may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokemon in any way you like. If you do, heal 50 damage from those Pokemon for each card you attached to them in this way.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokemon has at least 3 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Solgaleo & Lunala-GX
Attack1Text: This Pokemon can't use Cosmic Burn during your next turn.
Attack2Text: If you played Lillie's Full Force from your hand during this turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to each of your Pokemon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Oricorio-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokemon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dance of Tribute Ability each turn.
Attack2Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Flygon-GX
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, all of your Pokemon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Alolan Persian-GX
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon by your opponent's TAG TEAM Pokemon and Ultra Beasts, and by your opponent's Pokemon that have any Special Energy attached to them.
Attack2Text: This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: For the rest of this game, your Pokemon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), when your opponent's Active Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Reshiram & Zekrom-GX
Attack1Text: Discard up to 3 in any combination of basic Fire and basic Lightning Energy cards from your Benched Pokemon. This attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.
Attack2Text: This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. If you played N's Resolve from your hand during this turn, this attack also does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's other Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokemon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy and 1 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 2 Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Attack1Text: This attack does 60 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokemon-GX and Pokemon-EX in play.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep. If this Pokemon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 200 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Silvally-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.
Attack1Text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is an Ultra Beast, it is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
